content:
• Wednesday, January 24, 2018
  • VUZI

    Vuzix in $30M registered direct offering

    • Smart-glasses maker Vuzix (NASDAQ:VUZI) has entered into agreements with institutional investors on an above-market intra-day direct offering.
    • The agreements relate to selling 3M shares of common stock at $10/share, along with 1-year warrants to buy an aggregate 1.2M shares at the same price.
    • The warrants will be immediately exercisable for a one-year period.
    • Gross proceeds will be $30M; net proceeds will go to general purposes including the commercial launch of Blade Smart Glasses.
    • Shares rose 8.5% during the regular session to hit $10.80; they're quoting down 7% after hours to $10.04.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 PM | 30 Comments
  • BOLD

    Audentes prices 5.75M-share offering at $35

    • Audentes Therapeutics (NASDAQ:BOLD) has priced the public offering it announced yesterday.
    • The company's offering 5.75M shares of common stock at $35 each. Shares closed today at $35.46, down 4.8%.
    • Underwriters have a 30-day option to buy up to 862,500 more shares at the offering price.
    • Gross proceeds will be about $201.3M.
    • Joint book-runners are BofA Merrill Lynch, Cowen and Leerink Partners, with Wedbush PacGrow as a co-manager.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 names new product GMs, chief strategy officer, chief of human resources

    • Along with earnings after the closing bell, F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) set appointments to new strategic positions.
    • All new executives report directly to CEO/President François Locoh-Donou.
    • Two of the execs will take over product portfolio management and product and solutions marketing in their areas: Kara Sprague as general manager of Application Delivery Controller, and Ram Krishnan as general manager of Security.
    • Tom Fountain will lead M&A as executive VP and chief strategy officer. He'll also oversee corporate development, business development, tech partnerships and new business incubation.
    • Ana White will become the company's first chief human resources officer, taking responsibility for more than 4,500 employees worldwide.
    • Shares are up 3.6% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 PM
  • DLB

    Dolby Labs +9% after big quarterly beat, upside Q2 guidance

    • Dolby Laboratories (NYSE:DLB) +9.4% after-hours as it easily beats expectations for FQ1 earnings and revenues, and guides earnings and revenues above consensus.
    • "We had a strong first quarter and are off to a great start this year," says President and CEO Kevin Yeaman. "Adoption of Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos continues to expand, with more mainstream availability of TVs and sound bars, and the first PC with Dolby Vision announced by Lenovo."
    • DLB issues upside guidance for Q2, seeing EPS of $0.74-$0.80 vs. $0.71 analyst consensus estimate on revenues of $295M-$305M vs. $290.5M consensus; for FY 2018, DLB expects revenues of $1.15B-$1.18B vs. $1.16B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • LTBR

    Lightbridge +76% in anticipation of news on proposed JV

    • Lightbridge (NASDAQ:LTBR) +76.3% after-hours following news that it will hold a joint press conference tomorrow morning with principals of Framatome (formerly Areva NP) to discuss  "an anticipated major corporate development, in connection with the proposed joint venture between the two companies."
    • A JV could provide LTBR with the necessary resources and expertise to bring its metallic fuel technology to commercialization.
    • LTBR shares already are up ~50% for the week after saying Monday that it received a notice of allowance for patenting its metallic nuclear fuel assembly design.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 11 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/24/2018)

    • Top gainers: VAR +11.5%. DLB +8.5%. AMSC +5.3%. XLNX +4.5%. KOS +3.4%.
    • Top losers: OCUL -12.0%. CLS -8.0%. RCKT -3.8%. INSY -2.3%. EC -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • TER

    Teradyne -6% despite Q4 beats, in-line guidance

    • Teradyne (NYSE:TER) shares are down 6% aftermarket despite Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • In-line Q1 guidance has revenue from $460M to $490M (consensus: $489.63M) and EPS from $0.38 to $0.45 (consensus: $0.44). 
    • Revenue breakdown: Semiconductor Test, $317M (+17%); System Test, $80M; Industrial Automation, $54M; Wireless Test, $28M.  
    • Universal Robotics sales +72% from 2016. 
    • Key metrics: Cash from operating activities, $147.5M; cash and equivalents, $429.8M; operating expenses, $174.9M; total liabilities, $1.1B.
    • Share repurchase program: Board approves $1.5B common stock repurchase that replaces the existing $500M repurchase authorization. 
    • Earnings call is tomorrow at 10 AM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release       
    • Previously: Teradyne beats by $0.12, beats on revenue (Jan. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 7 Comments
  • IOVA

    Iovance Bio's TILs show positive effect in mid-stage study in cervical and head and neck cancer

    • Iovance Biotherapeutics (NASDAQ:IOVA) announces positive preliminary results from two open-label Phase 2 studies assessing autologous Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocytes (LN-145) in patients with cervical and head and neck cancers.
    • Data from study C-145-03 showed a 37.5% (n=3/8) response rate in patients with recurrent/metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck. The eight patients received a median of four prior treatments and all received prior anti-PD-1 therapy. Two also received anti-CTLA-4 therapy.
    • Data from study C-145-04, albeit on a small sample, showed one partial response and one with stable disease in patients with recurrent/metastatic or persistent cervical carcinoma.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 18 Comments
  • XLNX

    Xilinx +4.5% after Q3 revenue beat, ninth consecutive quarter rev growth

    • Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) shares are up 4.5% aftermarket following Q3 results that beat revenue estimates with the ninth consecutive quarter of revenue growth.
    • Q4 guidance has revenue from $635M to $665M (consensus: $634.40M), gross margin from 69% to 71%, operating expenses at $285M, and a tax rate up to 5%.
    • Net revenues by end market (percentages): Communications & Data Center, 35% (-12% Y/Y); Industrial, Aerospace & Defense, 47% (+23%); Broadcast, Consumer & Automotive, 18% (+24%).
    • Advanced Products (UltraScale+, Ultrascale and 7-series products) accounted for 56% of overall net revenues, up 30% on the year. Core Products dropped 12%. Core Products includes Virtex-6, Spartan-6, Virtex‐5, CoolRunner‐II, Virtex-4, Virtex-II, Spartan-3, Spartan-2, XC9500 products, configuration solutions, software & support/services.
    • Key metrics: Operating cash flow, $185M; total operating expenses, $259.3M; cash and equivalents, $3.5B.
    • Press release
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Previously: Xilinx EPS of $0.05 (Jan. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 5 Comments
  • SSTI

    Shotspotter up 6% after inking Verizon partnership

    • Shotspotter (NASDAQ:SSTI) is up 6% in AH trading after a partnership with Verizon is announced.
    • The company says it will utilize Verizon's IoT platform with street lights to help improve its gunshot detection system.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • VAR

    Varian FQ1 beat propels shares, up 15% after hours

    • Varian Medical Systems (NYSE:VAR) fiscal Q1 results ($M): Revenues: 678.5 (+12.8%).
    • Net loss: (112.2) (-999%); non-GAAP net income: 98.4 (+107.2%); EPS: (1.22) (-999%); non-GAAP EPS: 1.06 (+112.0%).
    • Order backlog: 3,020.8 (+10.4%).
    • Consensus: Non-GAAP EPS of $0.93 on revenues of $636.8M.
    • 2018 guidance: Revenue growth: 4 - 7%; non-GAAP EPS: $4.24 - 4.36; cash flow ops: $475M - 550M.
    • Shares are up 15% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • WHR

    Whirlpool slips after issuing soft guidance

    • Whirlpool (NYSE:WHR) slumps after setting profit guidance below expectations.
    • The company expects FY18 EPS of $14.50 to $15.50 vs. $15.52 consensus. Whirlpool also expects to generate cash from operating activities of ~$1.7B to $1.8B and free cash flow of ~$1.0B to $1.1B.
    • "We are confident that our cost reduction initiatives and global price/mix will be a catalyst for significant margin improvements in the coming year," says CFO Jim Peters.
    • Shares of Whirlpool are down 1.81% in AH trading to $175.73.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • ALBO

    Albireo readies stock offering; shares off 1% after hours

    • Albireo Pharma (NASDAQ:ALBO) commences a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • LRCX

    Lam Research +3.4% on Q2 beats, upside guidance

    • Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) shares are up 3.4% aftermarket following Q2 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Upside Q3 guidance: Shipments, $3.05B to $3.3B; revenue, $2.73B to $2.98B (consensus: $2.64B); gross margin, 46% +/- 1%; operating margin, 29% +/- 1%; EPS, $4.20 to $4.50 (consensus: $3.75).
    • Key Q2 results: Shipments, $2.63B (+11% Y/Y); non-GAAP gross margin, 47.6% (+40 bps); operating margin, 30.2% (+60 bps).
    • Financials: Cash and equivalents, $6B (-$0.4B Q/Q); cash flow from operations, $29M; deferred revenue, $1.1B; operating expenses, $448.7M; total liabilities, $6.6B.
    • Staff change: Lam promotes COO Tim Archer to President effective immediately. Archer will retain his COO role. Current President and CEO Martin Anstice will keep his CEO role.
    • Press release
    • Earnings call will start at 5 PM Eastern with webcast available here.
    • Previously: Lam Research beats by $0.66, beats on revenue (Jan. 24)
    • Update: Semiconductor peers that could move with Lam include Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) , currently up 0.6%, and KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 50 Comments
  • ANGO

    FDA OKs accelerated approval pathway for AngioDynamics' NanoKnife for pancreatic cancer; shares up 1% after hours

    • AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO) is up 1% after hours in response to its announcement that the FDA has granted Expedited Access Pathway (EAP) status for its NanoKnife System for the treatment of Stage III (cancer has spread, but not metastasized) pancreatic cancer.
    • The goal of the EAP program is to enable timely patient access to medical devices that may provide more effective treatment than standard-of-care or for which no approved alternatives exist. It provides for accelerated agency review and the involvement of more senior FDA personnel.
    • The NanoKnife uses low-energy direct current electrical pulses to permanently open pores in target cell membranes which kills the cells. It is currently approved in the U.S. for the surgical ablation of soft tissue.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks +3.6% as software, services drive Q1 beat

    • F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV) is up 3.6% in postmarket trade after posting fiscal Q1 earnings that beat on top and bottom lines with strength in services and software solutions.
    • Net income rose to $141.6M on a non-GAAP basis from $130.3M.
    • Revenue breakout: Products, $227.3M (down 5.1%); Services, $295.9M (up 7%).
    • “We continue to see momentum with our software offerings, driven by customers deploying our solutions on-premises and in the public cloud,” says CEO François Locoh-Donou.
    • The company has a revenue goal for Q2 of $525M-$535M (vs. consensus for $528.2M) and EPS target of $2.24-$2.27 (above consensus for $2.13).
    • It's set a meeting for analysts and investors for March 8 at 8:30 a.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx EPS of $0.05

    • Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): Q3 EPS of $0.05 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.63.
    • Revenue of $631.19M (+7.8% Y/Y) beats by $1.19M.
    • Shares +1.8%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • LM

    Legg Mason beats by $0.26, beats on revenue

    • Legg Mason (NYSE:LM): Q3 GAAP EPS of $1.58 beats by $0.26.
    • Revenue of $793.1M (+10.9% Y/Y) beats by $23.79M.
    • Shares +2.2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CFMS

    ConforMIS launches stock offering; shares down 21% after hours

    • ConforMIS (NASDAQ:CFMS) commences a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are off 21% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • IOVA

    Iovance Bio readies stock offering; shares down 7% after hours

    • Iovance Biotherapeutics (NASDAQ:IOVA) initiates a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are off 7% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • VAR

    Varian Medical Systems beats by $0.13, beats on revenue

    • Varian Medical Systems (NYSE:VAR): Q1 EPS of $1.06 beats by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $679M (+12.9% Y/Y) beats by $42.2M.
    • Shares +10%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • OCUL

    Ocular Therapeutix readies stock offering; shares down 10% after hours

    • Ocular Therapeutix (NASDAQ:OCUL) launches a public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Shares are down 10% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 43 Comments
  • ONCE

    Spark out-licenses gene therapy voretigene neparvovec to Novartis ex-U.S. for up to $170M; shares up 1% after hours

    • Spark Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ONCE) inks an agreement with Novartis (NYSE:NVS) granting the latter development and commercialization rights to gene therapy voretigene neparvovec outside of the U.S.
    • Under the terms of the deal, Novartis will pay Spark $105M in upfront cash, up to $65M in milestones and royalties on net sales.
    • Spark will retain exclusive rights to the product in the U.S., approved by the FDA last month, and will be responsible for European regulatory approval.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 7 Comments
  • LVS

    Net income more than doubles at Las Vegas Sands

    • Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) reports total consolidated property EBITDA increased 19.7% to $1.34B in Q4 vs. $1.22B consensus. On a hold-normalized basis, EBITDA was up 18.9% to $1.29B.
    • Net income was up 124% to $1.36B during the quarter, inclusive of a $526M non-cash income tax benefit.
    • Revenue from the Venetian Macao jumped 19.4% to $728M. Adjusted EBITDA rose 24% to $324M on a margin of 38.4% of sales vs. 37.1% a year ago.
    • Revenue from Sands Cotai rose 25.5% to $557M. Adjusted EBITDA increased 53% to $202M on a margin of 36.3% of sales vs. 29.7% a year ago.
    • Revenue from Las Vegas operations was up 2.4% to $422M. Adjusted EBITDA came in at 114M on a margin of 27.0% of sales vs. 26.9% a year ago.
    • Shares of Las Vegas Sands are up 2.65% AH to $79.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 19 Comments
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands beats by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS): Q4 EPS of $0.88 beats by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $3.44B (+11.7% Y/Y) beats by $170M.
    • Shares +2.3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 15 Comments
  • EGN

    Energen upgraded, Range Resources downgraded at Morgan Stanley

    • Energen (EGN -0.4%) is upgraded to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $75 price target, hiked from $56, while Range Resources (RRC -1.9%) is downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight with a $14 target, trimmed from $17, at Morgan Stanley to reflect a preference for oil over natural gas as it expects oil markets to tighten and gas to remain weak in 2018.
    • Stanley sees EGN moving higher as investors recognize management's improved execution, rising capital efficiency and a quality asset base, while a best-in-class balance sheet gives the stock downside support
    • Meanwhile, the firm thinks RRC is at risk for further multiple compression with few potential positive catalysts, and says the company's "frustrated shareholder base is likely to continue capitulating."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 56 Comments
  • SSYS

    Stratasys -1.1% after passive investor lowers stake

    • Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) shares drop 1.1% after Fisher Investments slightly lowers its passive stake from 5.79% to 5.76%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • TROX

    Tronox -8% after suing FTC over titanium dioxide deal

    • Tronox (TROX -8.5%) is suing the Federal Trade Commission, saying the agency is resorting to improper tactics to block its proposed acquisition of the titanium dioxide business of Saudi Arabian firm Cristal.
    • TROX says it is filing the lawsuit because the FTC is relying "solely on an administrative process that could not possibly conclude before the acquisition agreement expires, a thinly veiled attempt to run out the clock instead of resolving its concerns about the transaction on their merits," and a court action is needed for a prompt resolution.
    • The deal with Cristal was announced in February 2017, and TROX says either party would have the right to terminate the agreement if the deal is not completed by May unless the date is amended.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • JD

    JD.com chief: U.S. using 'serious' protectionism against China

    • The U.S. is practicing "serious" protectionism against Chinese firms, says JD.com (JD +3.5%) Chairman/CEO Richard Liu.
    • That's going to backfire, he said at the World Economic Forum: "One day it will hurt the U.S. economy too."
    • Liu's reaction is one of many in the wake of yesterday's import tariffs on solar panels and washing machines.
    • JD.com wants to not only overtake Alibaba but also become a global player, Liu says, but it's been difficult to get into the U.S. market.
    • It's focused on Southeast Asia for now and growth both organically and via acquisition: "It's hard to use only one model. In Southeast Asia, we look for local partners to develop business, but we don't want to exclude acquisitions."
    • Previously: JD weighs dual listing for logistics unit (Jan. 24 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 37 Comments

  • White House attempts half-hearted stick-save on dollar

    • Treasury Secretary Mnuchin earlier today sent the dollar to a new bear market low when he extolled the virtues of a weak greenback to a Davos audience.
    • Also in Davos, Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross tried to walk back those comments, and in D.C., White House spokesperson Sarah Sanders tells reporters the dollar is stable, reflecting the strength of the economy.
    • Nice words, but the administration has made clear for months its preference for a weaker currency. It's getting it ... bigly.
    • The dollar index remains down 1% on the session at a three-year low.
    • ETFs: UUP, UDN, USDU
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 22 Comments
  • SPWR

    SunPower says it will seek exemption from Trump tariffs

    • SunPower (SPWR -4.5%) CEO Tom Werner says the company plans to ask for an exemption to the 30% tariff on imported solar panels, saying it could hire more workers at its San Jose, Calif., headquarters and invest in a “pilot” factory there if it is excluded from import duties.
    • Werner says SPWR’s solar panel is a high-efficiency model that produces more power than any other in commercial production, allowing the manufacturer to sell it for a premium to competitors from China.
    • SPWR shares have swooned ~11% since Pres. Trump approved the tariff on Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 8 Comments
  • CWST

    Casella Waste +6% as Stifel upgrades to Buy

    • Casella Waste Systems (CWST +5.7%) pushes out to a new 52-week high before easing back after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $28 price target, raised from $22, following a visit with company management.
    • CWST can suggest 3%-4% organic growth, including the Southbridge closure, Stifel says, based on a reported price trend of 2.5%-3.5% in collection and 3.5% for landfill.
    • If CWST adds $30M/year in deal growth, supporting 4% organic growth, the firm says it would lead to 25-35 bps of annual margin expansion and low-double-digit free cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (1/24/18)

    • Gainers: OHGI +37%. RFIL +19%. ANY +13%. RCM +12%. XPER +8%.
    • Losers: SIGM -15%. HIMX -10%. RVLT -9%. CNIT-OLD -8%. SUNW -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 8 Comments
  • SWKS

    JPMorgan cuts sales forecasts for Apple suppliers on weakening iPhone sales

    • JPMorgan analyst Bill Peterson reduces sales forecasts for Apple suppliers on weakening iPhone demand.
    • Peterson drops Skyworks (SWKS -2.1%) 2018 forecast from $4.24B to $4.11B (consensus: $4.13B) and Knowles (KN -1.5%) from $779M to $772M (consensus: $798M).
    • Firm reiterates a Neutral rating on both suppliers.  
    • Previously: Apple, suppliers move after JPMorgan says iPhone X build will weaken (Jan. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 8 Comments
  • EBR

    Eletrobras expects to raise up to $4B in new share sale, CEO says

    • Eletrobras (EBR +9.1%) expects to raise up to $4B with the sale of new shares as part of its privatization, says CEO Wilson Ferreira Jr., adding that exact terms of the transaction should be decided by Aug. 15.
    • Brazil's government owns nearly 60% of EBR, which would be diluted through a capital increase with an option for a secondary offering of government shares under the terms of a draft bill sent to Congress this week.
    • The sale of EBR likely will be Brazil’s largest privatization since Vale was sold by the government 20 years ago.
    • Brazilian shares are trading higher across the board after a panel of judges upheld the conviction of ex-Pres. Lula, which would prevent the ex-populist from running for president in the October election.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • EA

    EA dips on report that 'Anthem' slips to 2019

    • Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) has slipped 2.2% and hit session lows after a report that its high-stakes multiplayer actioner Anthem will come out later than expected.
    • Anthem, from studio BioWare, is now set for early 2019, later than a "fall 2018" window mentioned at E3 2017, Kotaku reports.
    • While an exact timetable isn't set, Kotaku's sources say it's unlikely that EA will let BioWare delay the game any further than the end of its fiscal year, in March 2019.
    • Most of BioWare's staff is working on Anthem despite small teams working on maintaining Star Wars: The Old Republic and developing the next Dragon Age.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 4 Comments
  • GD

    General Dynamics +5% as cash flow, improved margins impress

    • General Dynamics (GD +5.2%) marches to a new 52-week high after beating Q4 earnings expectations, helped by higher sales for its combat systems unit that overshadowed a a slight miss in overall revenue.
    • CEO Phebe Novakovic said in today's earnings conference call that GD was not able to convert its backlog of orders into revenue quickly enough last year, blaming the new administration and the use by Congress of Continuing Resolutions in lieu of a federal budget but adding that the situation had changed late in 2017.
    • GD said Q4 revenues in the unit that makes tanks climbed 7.6% to $5.95B, while sales in the aerospace division, its biggest, rose 4% to $8.13B as it delivered 30 Gulfstream aircraft in the quarter, up from 28 a year earlier.
    • Vertical Research reiterates a Buy rating and $237 price target on shares while noting that defense company earnings likely will be muddied with one-time items related to tax changes; GD came in a bit light on an operating basis but was outweighed by solid cash flow and improved margins, the firm says.
    • Citigroup attributes GD's rally to management's "very constructive commentary" about business jet orders, such as the second-best order quarter for the G60 since its launch.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 15 Comments
  • BBD

    Big day for Brazil after Lula conviction upheld

    • Not only was the ex-president's conviction upheld, but one of the three-judge panel voted to increase his jail sentence to 12 years from nine.
    • Brazilian markets aren't taking off in joy thanks to vengeance, but because the decision means the populist won't be able to run for president in October (he is leading in the polls).
    • EWZ +5.1%
    • Bradesco (BBD +6.4%), Santander Brasil (BSBR +5.8%), Itau Unibanco (ITUB +5.7%), Telefonica Brasil (VIV +6.4%), Centrais Eletricas Brasileiras (EBR +9%), (EBR.B +12.6%), PetroBas (PBR +8%), Vale (VALE +3.6%)
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BRF, EWZS, BZQ, BRAQ, UBR, BRAZ, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 75 Comments
  • MDB

    Nomura initiates MongoDB; shares -2.5%

    • Nomura initiates MongoDB (NASDAQ:MDB) with a Neutral rating and $30 price target, which is a 4% upside on yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Christopher Eberle cites the crowded database market and MongoDB’s significant burn rate.   
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • MongoDB shares are down 2.5% to $28.11.    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: MDR +14%. RKDA +9%. NG +9%. CRK +8%. KOS +8%.
    • Losers: LTBR -10%. RES -9%. RCON -9%. TROX -8%. REXX -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 7 Comments
  • BIIB

    Profit-taking weighs on biotechs and biopharmas

    • Investors appear to be bagging profits after the healthy runup since mid-December. The Nasdaq composite is down 1% while the SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI -2.2%) is down even more.
    • Selected tickers: (IBB -1.2%)(BIB -2.6%)(BBH -0.5%)(ARKG -1.5%)(BBC -2%)(PJP -1%)(IHE -0.9%)(XPH -1.1%)(PPH -0.4%)(BIIB -0.7%)(AMGN -0.4%)(CELG -1.4%) (GILD +0.1%) (VRTX +0.6%)(SHPG -1.8%)(REGN +0.2%)(SGEN -2.4%)(JNJ +0.1%)(ABBV)(AGN -0.9%)(AZN -0.7%)(BMY +0.1%)(LLY +0.1%)(GSK -0.4%)(MRK -1.1%)(PFE -0.1%)(VRX -11.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 45 Comments
  • SOI

    Solaris +5% as it forecasts boost in mobile proppant management fleet

    • Solaris Oilfield Infrastructure (SOI +5.2%) surges higher after its operations update shows increased manufacturing capacity and the startup of its Kingfisher transload facility in Oklahoma with a first proppant rail shipment.

    • Suez (OTCPK:SZEVF, OTCPK:SZEVY) plunged 16.7% in Paris trading for its biggest-ever one-day percentage loss after the French water utility's preliminary 2017 earnings missed analyst expectations.
    • Suez says 2017 EBIT will come in at ~€1.28B ($1.58B), missing the analyst consensus €1.31B, and blames the results on political turmoil in the Spanish region of Catalonia and operational difficulties that forced it to end contracts in Morocco and India.

  • CHL

    China opening telecom market with move to license virtual operators

    • In a move aimed at opening up a market dominated by state-owned actors, China will license virtual telecoms to set up shop, including those with foreign investment.
    • Such virtual operators would be able to lease and re-sell capacity from existing network owners, including China Mobile (CHL +1.2%), China Telecom (CHA +1.8%) and China Unicom (CHU +0.8%).
    • The country has been slow to open up its telecom market, but says there will be no limit on the number of licenses to be handed out.

    • Yesterday, the company hosted its Investor Day during which it presented data on "bad" cholesterol fighter inclisiran. Of particular note is its "vaccine-like" properties that may support once- or twice-yearly dosing.
    • Inclisiran lowers bad cholesterol (LDL-C) by turning off PCSK9 synthesis in the liver. Amgen's (AMGN +0.3%) Repatha (evolocumab) and Regeneron (REGN +0.9%) and Sanofi's (SNY +2%) Praluent (alirocumab) are monoclonal antibodies that bind to (inhibit) the PCSK9 enzyme.   • Dollar's decline deepens after Mnuchin comments

    • "A weaker dollar is good for us as it relates to trade and opportunities," said U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin this morning, shocking his listeners as he held court in Davos.
    • While the comment is probably just stating the obvious, Treasury Secretarys typically just say a strong dollar is good for the U.S., and move on to the next subject.
    • Mnuchin's remark has helped pushed the dollar to new lows on this bear run, with the greenback now at its weakest in more than three years. The PowerShares U.S. Dollar Index Bullish ETF (NYSEARCA:UUP) is down 0.95%, a pretty whopping one-day move.
    • The euro (NYSEARCA:FXE) earlier popped above $1.24 for the first time in more than two years. It's currently higher by 0.8% to $1.2395.
    • The pound (NYSEARCA:FXB) is up 1.55% to $1.4213, now completely erasing its post-Brexit-vote plunge.
    • The yen, loonie, aussie, and swissie are all also enjoying big moves today, and U.S. stock averages are all carving out new records.
    • ETFs: UUP, FXE, EUO, FXY, FXC, FXA, YCS, FXB, UDN, CYB, FXF, ERO, CNY, USDU, JYN, GBB, DRR, FXS, ULE, CROC, YCL, EUFX, FXCH, URR, DAUD, DCHF, DEUR, DGBP, DJPY, UAUD, UCHF, UEUR, UGBP, UJPY

  • AAPL

    Apple previews iOS 11.3 with battery management features, health records

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) offers a rare public preview of iOS 11.3, which is scheduled for a spring release.
    • New features included four additional characters for Animoji, the face-tracking feature on the iPhone X, and ARKit 1.5 for better insertion of virtual objects in real environments. 
    • The Health app will get a Records section that allows participating medical providers to send results and guidance directly to the patient’s phone. 
    • Apple also adds Advanced Mobile Location that will automatically give emergency services a caller’s current location.
    • New HomeKit software authentication will allow some developers to add HomeKit support to accessories without having Apple’s previously required hardware, which could help Apple move deeper into the smart home space. 
    • The pesky battery throttling issue is getting a fix – but not until a later beta version of iOS 11.3. Anyone with an iPhone 6 or later will have new features displaying battery health and service needs. Those with an iPhone 6 to iPhone 7 Plus will also see if dynamic performance management (the feature causing the throttling) turns on and the user can turn it off.   
    • Apple shares are down 0.9%.  
    • Previously: Apple's apology letter to consumers includes $29 batteries (Dec. 28, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 52 Comments
